name: Rapid shot and Flurry of blows
author: WhiZard

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
You see these feats and you think "an extra attack, this is just like dual-wielding." The problem is that it is not just like dual-wielding. For the first part the penalty of -2 is applied to the extra attack progression. You think "no biggy that's where the extra attack shows up." But it is a biggy, because unlike dual-wielding there are other factors competing for a position in the extra attack progression. These would be cleave, attacks of opportunity, and of course the biggest one, haste. For this reason I have included two charts to help someone make a decision about whether rapid shot is worth the investment, or whether one should look into a different combat mode than flurry of blows. Both charts give the expected value (exact average) of the number of hits over 20 rounds. This can be used accurately to make a choice based on most damage as well, as factoring in criticals will never alter the flurry vs. non-flurry or rapid shot vs. non-rapid shot difference by even one whole point. Each row of the table represents a difference of AB and AC, with the first row representing the normal first blow of the default progression with an AB 20 less than the AC, this is followed by 19 less than the AC, etc. until all progressions reach the point where rolling a 2 on the worst blow still is able to hit.
